A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
An absurd\, misandrist wasted opportunity. 

There is nothing 'original\," Rian Johnson\, about moronic humor\, insipid dialogue\, imbecilic plotting\, and the outright mischaracterization/assassination of established characters to suit a narrative purpose.

In his hubris\, Johnson attempts to impose Hollywood's favorite cliche\, the failed disillusioned antihero\, upon a man characterized by optimism\, goodness\, respect for life\, and a never-say-die attitude. Fans of the OT are justifiably enraged. 

And don't get me started on the attempted romantic pairing between a shirtless MASS MURDERER and the designated Jedi. This is unbelievably screwed-up messaging to be sending young women and young men.  
Do not turn Rey into Carmela Soprano\, making excuses for EVIL. 

And a note to the misandrists at Lucasfilm -- It isn't necessary to devalue and marginalize men in order to elevate women.  Yet this film does so again and again quite transparently. Which is a big part of the reason TLJ's 'plot' is an incoherent\, self-contradictory train wreck. 

Thanks so much for killing my interest in Episode 9 and ruining my enjoyment of both Force Awakens and the OT. 

On behalf of the wonderful men in my life I deeply resent what you've done in this film.  My family will not be giving Disney another dime as long as Kathleen Kennedy is running Lucasfilm.
